name: Valroth Demon
description: These huge, fiery demons are the greatest of their kind. They appear as massive horned figures wreathed in infernal fire and writhing shadows, wielding a huge flaming sword and a cruelly barbed whip. Many serve as champions and executioners for their infernal masters. All other demons obey their commands, and they often lead hordes of demons into battle.

abilities.name: Fire and Shadow
abilities.description: A valroth is surrounded by magical flames and shadows, granting it +1 Defense. For each ranged band farther than Engaged that an enemy is from a valroth, increase its Defense by 1

abilities.name: Hellfire Aura
abilities.description: A creature that begins its turn in Engaged range with a Valroth suffers 4 wounds from the demon's blazing aura

abilities.name: Whip Drag
abilities.description: A valroth that Ensnares a target with its whip may suffer 2 strain to drag the target one range band closer, to a minimum of Engaged. While a target is Ensnared, the valroth cannot use its whip to make attacks.

name: Auroch
description: These large, shaggy herbivores are commonly used as beasts of burden. While largely docile, they can be very dangerous when injured or frightened.

name: Zombie
description: Mindless and relentless, zombies stagger slowly towards any living creature they see. Their only impulse is to kill. They present little challenge in small numbers, but they are often accompanied by necromancers, or more powerful undead.

name: Wraith (Creature Catalogue)
description: When a supremely evil person dies, they sometimes leave behind a malevolent echo of themselves, known as a wraith. Wraiths exist only to destroy life. Their incorporeal nature and life-draining attacks make them terrifying opponents.

name: Wight
description: Wights are undead warriors whose lust for battle is stronger than the grave. They are frequently found haunting the tombs, cairns, and barrows where they were once laid to rest.

name: Will O'Wisp
description: Will o' wisps are evil undead vestiges that manifest as small, glowing balls of light. They feed on fear and despair, and frequently lure travellers into dangerous environments or monster lairs to feed on their fear. Skilled magic users can sometimes extract the essence of a fallen wisp to create a lightstone.

abilities.name: Deceptive Illumination
abilities.description: A will o' wisp can shed light out to Medium range, or as little as Engaged range. It can appear as candlelight, torchlight, or virtually any form of luminescence it chooses. It can change the range of its illumination, or its appearance, as an incidental

abilities.name: Invisibility
abilities.description: As an action, a will o' wisp may turn invisible, extinguishing its light. It may sustain this invisibility by spending a maneuver to concentrate each turn. It cannot remain invisible if it attacks

abilities.name: Consume Life
abilities.description: Once per turn, a will o' wisp engaged with an Incapacitated creature may attempt to consume its life as an incidental. The creature must make an :average: Resilience check or die immediately. If the creature dies, the will o' wisp regains 6 wounds

name: Vampire, Dracul
description: Vampires of the Dracul bloodline are formidable warriors and cunning deceivers. They are quite adept at blending into civilized societies, which they prey on from the inside. It is not until a town or village is overrun with vampire spawn that the truth of the Dracul's masquerade is revealed. No two Dracul vampires are the same: some may have powers other than those listed here.

abilities.name: Mesmeric Gaze
abilities.description: As a maneuver, a Dracul vampire may attempt to mesmerise a target. This is a Coercion check opposed by the target's Discipline. If the vampire succeeds, the target is immobilized until the end of its next turn. The vampire may spend :advantage::advantage::advantage: on the check to stagger the target as well. If the check generates :triumph: for the vampire, instead of immobilizing and/or staggering the target, the vampire may spend 3 strain to choose the target's next maneuver and action

abilities.name: Mist Form
abilities.description: A vampire reduced to 0 wounds dissolves into an eerie mist, and attempts to return to its resting place. If it cannot return to its resting place before dawn, or is exposed to direct sunlight, it is destroyed. If it reaches its resting place, it reforms and is Incapacitated until the next sunset, when it arises, fully restored. If the vampire is slain in its resting place while Incapacitated, it is destroyed

name: Vampire, Orlok
description: Vampires of the Orlok bloodline are grotesque creatures that skulk through the  shadows, spreading pestilence and horror in their wake. Most take up residence in sewers, cave systems, abandoned tombs or castles, attended by their feral spawn and swarms of vermin. No two Orlok vampires are the same: some may have powers other than those listed here.

abilities.name: Command Beasts
abilities.description: An Orlok vampire can direct the actions of certain beasts (rats, bats, insects, spiders, wolves) with a Willpower lower than 3 within Long range as an out-of-turn incidental

abilities.name: Pestilent Bite
abilities.description: A living target bitten by an Orlok vampire must make a :daunting: check or become afflicted with a wasting disease. The target immediately reduces its wound and strain thresholds by four each. Each day, the target must repeat this check until it succeeds, or dies. A character that dies from the wasting disease, or dies while afflicted by it, will rise at nightfall as a vampire spawn

abilities.name: Mist Form
abilities.description: A vampire reduced to 0 wounds dissolves into an eerie mist, and attempts to return to its resting place. If it cannot return to its resting place before dawn, or is exposed to direct sunlight, it is destroyed. If it reaches its resting place, it reforms and is Incapacitated until the next sunset, when it arises, fully restored. If the vampire is slain in its resting place while Incapacitated, it is destroyed

name: Vampire Spawn
description: Vampire spawn are newly turned vampires, and are often nearly feral, seeking only to slake their thirst upon the living. They are usually subservient to the vampire that created them, but sometimes they are abandoned to wander on their own. While they are much weaker than true vampires, when they band together in packs, they can be daunting foes.

name: Spectre
description: A lesser form of undead created by a wraith, a spectre is aware that it has been cheated of passing into the afterlife. It feels nothing but rage and hatred towards the living.

name: Mummy Lord
description: Mummy lords are the reanimated remains of great sorcerer-kings. They jealously guard their tombs and secrets, annihilating trespassers and tomb robbers without mercy. While they superficially resemble lesser mummies, they are usually clad in rotting finery and jewelry befitting their status in life. All are potent spellcasters.

abilities.name: Curse of the Pharaoh
abilities.description: A living creature struck by a mummy lord’s fist attack must make a :daunting: Resilience check. If they fail, they are afflicted with the Curse of the Pharaoh: Reduce their wound and strain thresholds by 6, and subtract one from all ability checks. They must repeat this check each day [with the same result for failure] until they succeed, or are Incapacitated [at which point they die and turn to dust]. The curse can be broken by Divine magic by succeeding at a :daunting: Divine check

abilities.name: Spells: Sandstorm
abilities.description: Choose a target at short or medium range for this attack and make an :average: Arcana check. If successful, this magic attack inflicts 8 damage +1 damage per :success:, with the Disorient 2 and Knockdown qualities.

abilities.name: Spells: Aegis of Thoth
abilities.description: Make a :hard: Arcana check; if successful, until the end of the mummy lord’s next turn, reduce the damage of all hits against them by one, plus one for every 2 Success, and the mummy lord gains +3 defense. The mummy lord can maintain these effects with the concentrate maneuver.

abilities.name: Spells: Summon Scarabs
abilities.description: Make a :hard: Arcana check; if successful, the mummy lord summons a scarab swarm at engaged range. The scarab swarm is an ally to the mummy lord.

gear: Pharaoh's Crown (Implement; when the mummy lord casts the Conjure spell to summon an ally, adding the Summon Ally effect does not increase its difficulty. In addition, the creature(s) remain summoned until the end of the encounter without the mummy lord having to use the concentrate maneuver)
Pharaoh's Crook (Implement; functions as a magical staff)

name: Bugbear
description: The largest and strongest of the goblinoids, bugbears rule over their weaker kin without mercy. They are surprisingly stealthy, and favor ambushes followed by overwhelming violence.
gear: Oiled chainmail (+2 soak, no stealth penalty)

name: Ancient Wurm
description: An ancient wurm is a truly terrifying colossal beast with two huge forelimbs and a serpentine body. They spend most of their time asleep, but when they wake, they can ravage nations.

name: Bear (Creature Catalogue)
description: This profile can be used to represent any large bear, like a grizzly or polar bear (add cold immunity for polar bears).

name: Camel
description: Foul tempered and belligerent, camels nevertheless make excellent mounts and beasts of burden in arid desert environments.

abilities.name: Sand Walker
abilities.description: Remove :setback: from any checks made to traverse sandy or desert terrain

name: Crocodile
description: This profile can be used for any large crocodilian creature (alligators, caimans).

name: Elk
description: These large, powerful beasts dwell in remote forests. They prefer to avoid combat, but will fight fiercely if pressed.

abilities.name: Sure Footed
abilities.description: Elk suffer no penalties when moving through difficult terrain

name: Horse (Creature Catalogue)
description: This profile represents a typical work or riding horse.

name: Rhinoceros
description: Large, powerful, and easily angered, rhinoceroses are remarkable but dangerous animals.

name: Riding Elephant
description: A trained elephant makes for an impressive and dangerous mount.

name: Tiger
description: This profile can be used for most great cats.

abilities.name: Fierce Pounce
abilities.description: If a tiger uses the aim maneuver, it gains the Knockdown quality on its next claw attack

name: Warhorse (Creature Catalogue)
description: Bred and trained for military use, a warhorse is a powerful asset to any fighting force, and a reliable companion to a soldier or knight.

name: Wolf (Creature Catalogue)
description: This profile can be used for many types of pack-hunting creatures.

abilities.name: Pack Tactics
abilities.description: If more than one wolf is engaged with a target, all wolves engaged with that target gain 1 Boost die to combat checks

name: Wooly Mammoth
description: A powerful, heavily furred elephantine beast native to colder climates, mammoths are known for their massive tusks and irritable temperament.

name: Lost Souls
description: The damned souls of those who have sold their souls to the infernal powers, these pitiful creatures are playthings and fodder to even lesser demons. They are often herded into battle for the amusement of their masters.

abilities.name: Aura of Despair
abilities.description: Any non-demonic creature Engaged with a troupe of lost souls increases the difficulty of any Willpower-based skill check they make by one

name: Lesser Demon
description: While clumsy, slow, and stupid, lesser demons can still prove very dangerous in large numbers. As the least of the true demons, they are particularly vicious towards lost souls, and anyone else they can bully or torment. Though they can vary greatly in appearance, all lesser demons use the same stat block.

abilities.name: Miasma
abilities.description: Any non-demonic creature within Short range of lesser demons must make a :hard: Resilience check at the start of their turn, or suffer 2 strain from their nauseating emissions

abilities.name: Strength in Numbers
abilities.description: If there is more than one minion group of lesser demons within Short range of each other, all such groups gain +1 damage

name: Hell Bat Swarm
description: Though they appear to be hideous bat-like beasts, these winged terrors are true demons. They wheel about in swarms over the battlefields where their greater kin fight, blinding foes and feeding on the fallen.

abilities.name: Teeming Threat
abilities.description: As a maneuver, a swarm may engage all living targets within Short range, and take an attack action against each target

abilities.name: Swarm
abilities.description: Halve the damage dealt to the swarm before applying soak, unless the weapon has the Blast or Burn quality [regardless of whether the quality is activated]

abilities.name: Blinding Swarm
abilities.description: Enemies who are Engaged with a hell bat swarm suffer :setback::setback: on all checks

weapons.name: Piercing Bites
weapons.notes: May spend :advantage::advantage: to inflict 2 additional wounds.

name: Barbakul Demon
description: Commonly called spined demons, these cunning creatures are exceptionally alert and stealthy, and often serve as the scouts and watchdogs of a demonic warhost. Barbakul are not as physically formidable as other demons, but their barbed hides and long piercing claws make them more than a match for most mortal foes.

abilities.name: Impalement
abilities.description: A barbakul may spend :threat::threat::threat: or :despair: on a melee combat check targeting them to cause the attacker to suffer 4 wounds from its barbed spikes

name: Narcarex Demon
description: When most races think of demons, these creatures are what come to mind. Narcarex, also called hellfire demons, are horned, winged, leering demons with red skin, cloven hooves, and long tails ending in a barbed tip. In battle, hellfire demons are wreathed in unholy flames, searing their enemies as they impale them with their vicious tridents.

abilities.name: Hellfire Aura
abilities.description: A creature that begins its turn in Engaged range with a Narcarex suffers 2 wounds from the demon's blazing aura

name: Antenoran Demon
description: Not all the realms of Hell are fiery; some are frozen wastelands. Antenoran demons hail from these icy regions, and are as cold and merciless as their homelands. Resembling a monstrous cross between a praying mantis and a dinosaur, antenorans often command warbands of weaker demons, driving them into battle while brandishing their terrible frigid polearms.

abilities.name: Icy Barrier
abilities.description: An antenoran may spend a Story Point to summon a barrier of ice within Short range to separate its enemies, or to enclose them. This can take the form of a wall up to 60 feet long, 10 feet high, and a foot thick, or a hemispherical dome 20 feet in height. The wall can be breached with a :daunting: Athletics check, or by dealing 10 or more points of damage in a single attack. The barrier is unnaturally frigid: non-demonic creatures in Engaged range of the barrier, or enclosed within it, suffer 3 wounds per turn from the brutal cold

name: Brachyuru Demon
description: These large, powerful demons revel in physical combat, and eagerly charge into battle against any foe. Brachyuru demons are massive, scaly humanoids with two sets of arms: one pair at the shoulders, ending in huge, crushing claws, and another pair emerging from their chest, with nimble, clawed fingers. Their heads resemble a hideous cross between a dog and a goat. Their legs end in savagely clawed feet. Every part of a brachyuru can, and is, used to attack.

abilities.name: Fearless
abilities.description: A brachyuru is immune to Coercion and fear from any source

abilities.name: Power Word: Stun
abilities.description: As a maneuver, a brachyuru may spend a Story Point to target an enemy in Short range with a blasphemous word of power. The target must succeed at a :hard: Discipline check or be staggered until the end of its next turn. If the target succeeds, it is immobilized instead. In either case, the target suffers 4 strain

name: Gorgul Demon
description: These demons are grotesquely obese, flabby creatures with wide, bulging eyes, absurdly large ears, oversized mouths, and extremely long, thin arms. While their appearance is somewhat comical, gorgul demons are terrifying opponents. They use their long arms to snatch opponents and shove them into their gaping mouths, where they are swallowed whole. A gorgul's stomach is transparent, so the gorgul can watch its prey digesting in its corpulent belly. They take enormous joy in this, emitting a continuous high-pitched giggle while grabbing for their next victim.

abilities.name: Corpulent
abilities.description: If a gorgul suffers a Critical Injury, subtract -30 from the Critical Injury result

abilities.name: Pest Control
abilities.description: A gorgul does not increase the difficulty of combat checks made against smaller targets

abilities.name: Swallow Whole
abilities.description: If a gorgul Ensnares a target of Silhouette 2 or smaller with its claw attack, it may spend :advantage::advantage::advantage: or :triumph: to swallow the target. While swallowed, the target is immobilized and begins to suffocate, and suffers 4 wounds at the start of its turn each round until it escapes or is Incapacitated. A target Incapacitated this way is digested and unrecoverable. A target may be freed by dealing at least 5 wounds to the gorgul with a bladed or piercing weapon in a single attack, allowing the target to escape the demon’s belly. A gorgul’s belly will reseal itself at the start of its turn. A gorgul can swallow up to two Silhouette 2 creatures, 8 Silhouette 1 creatures, or any number of Silhouette 0 creatures at one time. Anyone seeing a friend or ally trapped within the belly of a gorgul must make an :average: Fear check as an out-of-turn incidental

abilities.name: Giggle Fit
abilities.description: While a gorgul has one or more targets swallowed, it emits a hideous, high-pitched giggling sound. All non-demonic creatures within Medium range must make a :hard: Discipline check at the start of their turn as an incidental, or suffer 2 strain from the unnerving sound

abilities.name: Ponderous
abilities.description: A gorgul can spend no more than one maneuver per turn to move

name: Malithar Demon
description: Beautiful and lethal are the two words that best describe malithar demons. They have the heads and torsos of exceedingly beautiful women, with six arms, and a long, powerful serpentine lower body. They wield a weapon in each of their hands, preferring swords. While they are highly effective in battle, malithar most often act as captains for demonic hosts, as lesser demons crave malithar approval and will follow their orders eagerly.

abilities.name: Rain of Steel
abilities.description: A malithar has six limbs, and wields a weapon in each hand. A malithar does not increase the difficulty of its attacks to activate auto-fire, can activate auto-fire with :advantage:, and its initial target does not need to be the target with the highest difficulty and defense

abilities.name: Constrict
abilities.description: If a malithar Ensnares a target with its tail, it may use a maneuver to constrict the target. While constricted, the target is immobilized, and suffers 3 wounds per round at the start of its turn. A malithar can maintain constriction by spending a maneuver each round to do so, but cannot use maneuvers to move while doing so, and cannot make tail attacks. A target may escape the constriction by succeeding at an opposed Athletics check

name: Cyclops
description: Cyclopes are colossal, one-eyed giants with a single large horn protruding from their foreheads. They live alone, often tending herds of aurochs or giant sheep, and are fiercely territorial. Cyclopes are not smart, but they are among the most powerful giantkin, and can quickly kill unprepared intruders.

name: Hill Giant
description: Hill giants are the most loutish and stupid of the true giants. They are clumsy, voracious oafs that shamble about the land, eating everything they can find. They are particularly feared by farmers and settlers.

name: Fire Giant
description: Skilled craftsmen and brutal tyrants, fire giants are the most militaristic and organized of the giantkin. They prefer to live in volcanic regions, and are often accompanied by tamed hellhounds or salamanders.

abilities.name: Fireborn
abilities.description: A fire giant does not suffer damage from natural heat or flame, and doubles its soak for purposes of reducing damage from magical fire

abilities.name: Greatsword Sweep
abilities.description: On a successful Melee check, a fire giant can spend :advantage::advantage: per target to hit additional targets within Short range

name: Frost Giant
description: Savage raiders and merciless killers, frost giants terrorize the northern lands. They are often accompanied by trained winter wolves.

abilities.name: Berserk
abilities.description: A frost giant that suffers five or more wounds goes berserk, dealing +2 damage. If a frost giant suffers a Critical Injury, the bonus damage increases to +4 for the rest of the combat

name: Stone Giant
description: Stone giants dwell far from civilization on high mountains, in deep valleys, or in enormous cave systems. They are territorial, but generally will not attack unless provoked. They can throw boulders with extraordinary accuracy.

abilities.name: Stony Skin
abilities.description: If a stone giant suffers a Critical Injury, subtract -20 from the Critical Injury result

name: Bone Golem
description: Bone golems are horrid constructions created by necromancers. The bones of dozens or hundreds of creatures are fused together into a grotesque humanoid shape. While not the most powerful of their kind, bone golems are among the most frightening to encounter.

abilities.name: Terrifying
abilities.description: At the start of the encounter, all of their opponents must make a :hard: fear check as an out-of-turn incidental. If there are multiple sources of fear in the encounter, the opponents only make one fear check against the most terrifying enemy

abilities.name: Impalement
abilities.description: A bone golem may spend :threat::threat::threat: or :despair: on a melee combat check targeting them to cause the attacker to suffer 6 wounds from its bony spikes

name: Brass Golem
description: These golems are forged from articulated enchanted brass, and filled with a superheated fluid. They often have animal heads, especially bull heads. Brass golems are often used as temple guardians.

abilities.name: Super-heated Spray
abilities.description: A brass golem may spend :threat::threat::threat: or :despair: on a melee combat check targeting them to cause the attacker to suffer 6 wounds from its super-heated fluid

abilities.name: Achilles' Heel
abilities.description: A brass golem has a valve somewhere on its body that, if opened, will release its super-heated animating fluid. This requires a :hard: Perception check or a :daunting: Vigilance check to notice. In order to open the valve, a character must be Engaged with the brass golem, and make a :daunting: Skulduggery check. If they succeed, the fluid begins to rush out, and the brass golem suffers 4 wounds per round at the start of its turn until the valve is closed, or until it is defeated. The character that opens the valve will suffer 4 wounds from the fluid

name: Flesh Golem
description: Another frequent creation of necromancers and mad alchemists, flesh golems are abhorrent amalgamations of various dead beings stitched together into a greater form. They are difficult to control, and frequently run amok.

abilities.name: Lightning Absorption
abilities.description: A flesh golem takes no damage for magical or non-magical fire. If attacked with lightning, resolve the attack as normal, but the flesh golem heals a number of wounds equal to the damage dealt

abilities.name: Aversion to Fire
abilities.description: If a flesh golem is damaged by fire, it suffers :setback::setback: on its next skill check

abilities.name: Berserk
abilities.description: A flesh that suffers five or more wounds goes berserk, dealing +2 damage. If a flesh golem suffers a Critical Injury, the bonus damage increases to +4 for the rest of the combat

abilities.name: Fists of Fury
abilities.description: A flesh golem does not increase the difficulty of combined checks to attack with both fists

name: Iron Golem
description: Among the most powerful of all golems, iron golems are usually created by archmages as guardians of their greatest treasures. These implacable creations are nearly impossible to stop.

abilities.name: Greater Magic Resistance
abilities.description: An iron golem upgrades the difficulty of any magic skill check targeting it by two. Any offensive spell targeting an iron golem that generates :threat::threat::threat: or :despair: reflects back on the caster

abilities.name: Juggernaut
abilities.description: An iron golem is immune to immobilize, knockdown, forced movement, or any effect or condition that would inhibit its movement.

name: Stone Golem
description: These golems often take the form of humanoid stone statues, and can be difficult to detect when still. They are frequently constructed with multiple limbs, each wielding a weapon, and can attack relentlessly with all of them.

abilities.name: Multiple Limbs
abilities.description: A stone golem has four to six limbs, and wields a weapon in each hand. A stone golem does not increase the difficulty of its attacks to activate auto-fire, and its initial target does not need to be the target with the highest difficulty and defense

name: Basilisk
description: Basilisks are ponderous, eight-legged subterranean predators, well-known and feared for their petrifying gaze.

abilities.name: Petrifying Gaze
abilities.description: As a maneuver, a basilisk can force a target within Medium range to meet its deadly gaze. The basilisk makes an opposed Perception vs. Discipline check. If the target has not yet acted this turn, downgrade the difficulty by one. If the check succeeds, the target is immobilized and disoriented until the end of its next turn, when it may make a :hard: Resilience check as an incidental. If it succeeds, the effect ends. If it fails, the target is turned to stone and indefinitely Incapacitated. This may be dispelled by an ally with a successful :hard: Arcana check, or the character may be restored by a successful :hard: Heal check (using Divine or Primal)

name: Bat, Giant
description: These creatures are large and aggressive nocturnal predators. Giant bats are often found in caves and shadowy forests. They use their powerful sonic attacks to cripple and bring down prey from the air, then land to feast on their helpless victims.

abilities.name: Blindsight
abilities.description: Giant bats are unaffected by darkness penalties as long as they can hear

name: Black Slime
description: Tireless, mindless, and eternally hungry, black slime is one of the most feared perils of the deep places of the world. The potent acid of its seething form dissolves everything but stone.

abilities.name: Amorphous
abilities.description: As an incidental, a black slime may increase or decrease its silhouette by 1

abilities.name: Flailing Pseudopods
abilities.description: A black slime does not increase the difficulty of its attacks to activate auto-fire, and its initial target does not need to be the target with the highest difficulty and defense

abilities.name: Corrosive Form
abilities.description: Any weapon or object not made of stone that strikes a black slime is immediately damaged by one step. Any creature not made of stone that succeeds in a Brawl attack against a black slime suffers 6 damage. Any armour made of metal, wood, or leather that is struck by a black slime is immediately damaged by one step (in addition to its pseudopod's Sunder quality

name: Cave Fisher
description: Ese subterranean arachnids resemble large, flat, stone-coloured scorpions with eight legs and two large, shearing claws. They lurk in elevated places in caves and caverns, dangling transparent filaments to ensnare prey. When a living creature blunders into a filament, it is quickly reeled up to the cave fisher to be dismembered and devoured.

abilities.name: Dark Vision
abilities.description: A cave fisher suffers no Perception penalties even in complete darkness

abilities.name: Anchored
abilities.description: A cave fisher may use a maneuver to anchor itself. While anchored, it is immune to forced movement and knockdown. It can anchor itself to a floor, wall, or ceiling. It cannot take maneuvers to move while anchored. It may cease being anchored as an incidental

abilities.name: Filaments
abilities.description: A cave fisher extrudes a long, transparent, highly adhesive filament to capture prey. It requires a :hard: Vigilance check to notice a cave fisher filament. A target that touches the filament is automatically ensnared. A cave fisher may also shoot its filament out to capture prey, though this is not its preferred method of attack. A filament can be escaped with a :hard: Athletics check, or severed by dealing 5 wounds to it [Soak 3]. Severing a filament does not injure a cave fisher. A cave fisher can extrude a replacement filament on its turn as a maneuver

abilities.name: Reel
abilities.description: If a cave fisher Ensnares a target with a filament, it may use a maneuver to drag the target to itself

name: Chimera
description: Chimeras are horrible magical hybrid beasts with the hindquarters of a giant goat, the forequarters of a lion, the tail and wings of a dragon, and the heads of all three creatures. They are cruel predators who revel in violence, and will attack anything they perceive to be prey or a rival (i.e. virtually anything).

name: Coeurl
description: This creature resembles a huge, six-legged black panther, with two long, spiked tentacles protruding from its shoulders, and terrible glowing eyes. Also known as the “black destroyer”, the coeurl magically displaces light, appearing to be several feet away from its actual position... which is usually closer than you think.

abilities.name: Displacement
abilities.description: While it is not incapacitated or staggered, a coeurl gains 4 dice of concealment from its displacement ability. When an enemy takes a maneuver to engage a coeurl, it must succeed at a :hard: Perception check as an incidental; if it fails, it engages the coeurl's displaced form rather than the creature itself

abilities.name: Agile
abilities.description: A coeurl can perform a second maneuver to move without suffering strain. It still cannot exceed the limit of two maneuvers in a turn

name: Eagle, Giant
description: This profile can be used for any very large, predatory avian creature.

name: Ettin
description: These powerful two-headed giants are foul-smelling and bad-tempered. Thankfully, they prize solitude, and typically dwell far away from civilization. They are very difficult to surprise, and too aggressive to outwit.

abilities.name: Two Heads
abilities.description: An ettin may take a second maneuver each turn for free, but may take no more than two maneuvers total

abilities.name: Better Than One
abilities.description: Any effect that blinds, charms, disorients, knocks out, or staggers an ettin requires two additional Advantage to affect an ettin, even if the effect is normally automatic

name: Gargoyle
description: These creatures are evil earth elementals that dwell on the Material Plane. They can pose as grotesque statues for long periods of time, even years or decades, until they decide to attack. By folding their wings over themselves, they can also disguise themselves as rocks, boulders, or stone outcroppings.

abilities.name: False Appearance
abilities.description: While a gargoyle remains motionless, it is virtually indistinguishable from a stone statue or natural stone, depending on how it has concealed itself. It takes a :formidable: Perception check to identify a stationary gargoyle

abilities.name: Rake
abilities.description: If a gargoyle attacks on the same turn in which it engages a target, its claw attack gains the Linked 1 quality against that target

name: Griffon
description: Griffons are powerful predators, as adept at fighting on the ground as in the air.

name: Griffon, Owl
description: Owl griffons are larger and more deadly examples of their kind, easily recognized by their owl heads, wings, and talons. They prefer to hunt at night, and are nearly silent until they attack.

abilities.name: Silent Strike
abilities.description: An owl griffon that succeeds at an opposed Stealth vs Vigilance check may add any Advantage gained from the check as both successes on Initiative and as bonus damage on its first attack

name: Hellhound
description: Hellhounds are hulking canines that resemble mastiffs with fiery glowing eyes, and flames licking along their black coats. They are often kept as pets and guard dogs by fire giants.

abilities.name: Fireborn
abilities.description: A hellhound does not suffer damage from natural heat or flame, and doubles its soak for purposes of reducing damage from magical fire

name: Hydra
description: A hydra is a massive reptilian predator, with a powerful sauropod-like body, and five shark-like heads on long, serpentine necks. They are renowned, and feared, for their ability to regrow their severed heads. Hydras are endlessly voracious, and will gladly feed on any living (or dead) creature they can catch. They are also extremely difficult to surprise, thanks to their multiple heads.

abilities.name: Amphibious
abilities.description: A hydra may remain submerged for up to one hour, and suffers no movement penalties in water

abilities.name: Terrifying
abilities.description: At the start of the encounter, all of their opponents must make a :hard: fear check as an out-of-turn incidental. If there are multiple sources of fear in the encounter, the opponents only make one fear check against the most terrifying enemy

abilities.name: Colossal
abilities.description: If a hydra suffers a Critical Injury, subtract -20 from the Critical Injury result

abilities.name: Pest Control
abilities.description: A hydra does not increase the difficulty of combat checks made against smaller targets

abilities.name: Regeneration
abilities.description: A hydra regenerates 8 wounds at the end of its turn. If the hydra suffered damage from fire or acid since its last turn, reduce the regeneration to 4 wounds

abilities.name: Many Heads
abilities.description: A hydra attacks with its many heads, biting any targets within reach. A hydra does not increase the difficulty of the combat check to use auto-fire, and only requires :advantage: to activate auto-fire, but it cannot assign more than three hits to a single target each round. :triumph: is treated as :advantage::advantage: for the purposes of activating auto-fire

abilities.name: Tail Sweep
abilities.description: Once per round, a hydra may spend :threat::threat::threat: or :despair: generated by an opponent's melee attack check to automatically hit the opponent with a tail sweep attack for base damage

name: Landshark
description: The landshark, or bulette, is supposedly the result of sorcerous crossbreeding. It is a voracious, nomadic predator that greedily devours anything it can catch.

abilities.name: Erupt
abilities.description: While tunneling, the landshark may use its Ground Burst attack against a target within Short range

name: Landshark, Ancient
description: Landsharks never stop growing, even as adults, though they do so much more slowly. An ancient landshark is a truly terrible monster, as insatiable as it is unstoppable.

abilities.name: Erupt
abilities.description: While tunneling, an ancient landshark may use its Ground Burst attack against a target within Short range

name: Manticore
description: A savage, clever predator born of sorcerous crossbreeding, manticores are monsters in every sense of the word. A manticore has a vaguely humanoid head with multiple rows of teeth, the body of a lion or tiger, and sweeping draconic wings. Its long tail ends in a cluster of spikes, which it can hurl with deadly accuracy.

name: Mimic
description: These shapeshifting predators are the bane of dungeon delvers. They take the forms of inanimate objects, such as doors, tables, and treasure chests; when prey comes within reach, or touches the mimic, it sprouts pseudopods and attacks.

abilities.name: False Appearance
abilities.description: As an action, a mimic may perfectly imitate an inanimate object of silhouette 0 to 2. While it remains motionless, a mimic is indistinguishable from an ordinary object

abilities.name: Adhesive
abilities.description: A mimic is highly adhesive. Increase the difficulty of any check to escape its Ensnare by 1

name: Mind Slayer
description: Remnants of an ancient species from an unknown world, mind slayers dwell in the darkness, enslaving weaker beings and devouring their brains for sustenance and pleasure. They are abhorred by all other species. Mind slayers are frequently accompanied by obedient thralls, and are occasionally willing to parley.

abilities.name: Magic Resistance
abilities.description: Increase the difficulty of any spell or magical effect targeting a mind slayer by one

abilities.name: Psionic Awareness
abilities.description: A mind slayer is aware of any living, thinking creature within Medium range. Attempts by a living, thinking creature to hide from a mind slayer automatically fail

abilities.name: Sacrifice Thrall
abilities.description: If a mind slayer is struck by an attack, it may spend :threat::threat: to cause an unengaged, active thrall within Short range to suffer the attack instead

abilities.name: Domination
abilities.description: As an action, a mind flayer may spend a Story Point to dominate a living, thinking target. This is an Arcana check opposed by the target's Discipline. If the target fails, the mind slayer may choose the target's next maneuver and action, but the target is disoriented

abilities.name: Devour Brain
abilities.description: As an action, a mind slayer may use Devour Brain against an engaged target Ensnared by its tentacles, or staggered by its Mind Blast. A target incapacitated by this attack is killed, and its brain devoured by the mind slayer. When a mind slayer devours a brain, it heals 5 Wounds and recovers 10 Strain

abilities.name: Mind Blast
abilities.description: As an action, a mind slayer may use Mind Blast. The mind slayer may target any number of living, thinking creatures within range. A target successfully hit by Mind Blast must make a :daunting: Discipline check. If it succeeds, the target is disoriented until the end of its next turn. If it fails, the target is staggered until the end of the encounter. It may make another :daunting: Discipline check at the end of each of its turns to recover from the effect

name: Owlbear
description: Few creatures are as bad-tempered and aggressive as the owlbear. They fearlessly attack anything that intrudes on their territory, regardless of size.

abilities.name: Berserker
abilities.description: When an owlbear suffers one or more wounds, it deals +2 damage with all attacks. If it suffers a Critical Injury, it deals +4 damage with all attacks

name: Owlbear, Dire
description: The only thing more bad-tempered and aggressive than an owlbear is a dire owlbear. These massive predators dominate their territory and ferociously assault any intruders.

abilities.name: Berserker
abilities.description: When a Dire Owlbear suffers one or more wounds, it deals +2 damage with all attacks. If it suffers a Critical Injury, it deals +4 damage with all attacks

name: Roper
description: These abominations mimic rock formations in caves and caverns, and greedily devour any living prey that comes too close, drawing them in with their adhesive tentacles, and devouring them with powerful jaws.

abilities.name: Anchored
abilities.description: A roper is immune to forced movement and knockdown. It can anchor itself to a floor, wall, or ceiling. It cannot move from its location during an encounter

abilities.name: Perfect Mimic
abilities.description: When a roper is inactive, it cannot be discerned from a normal cave formation

abilities.name: Flailing Tendrils
abilities.description: A roper does not increase the difficulty of its attacks to activate auto-fire, and its initial target does not need to be the target with the highest difficulty and defense

abilities.name: Tendrils
abilities.description: A roper may have six active tendrils at a time. A roper can't use the same tendril on more than one target at a time. A tendril can be escaped with a :hard: Athletics check, or severed by dealing 6 wounds to it [Soak 4]. Severing a tendril does not injure a roper. A roper can extrude a replacement tendril on its turn as a maneuver

abilities.name: Reel
abilities.description: If a roper Ensnares a target with a tentacle, it may use a maneuver to drag the target to its jaws and make a free Bite attack

name: Rust Monster
description: These subterranean scavengers are the bane of many adventurers. While normally docile, even friendly, they eagerly seek to corrode and consume any ferrous metal they can (usually in the form of armour and weapons).

abilities.name: Scent Iron
abilities.description: A rust monster can determine the location and volume of any ferrous metal within Short range. It is attracted to quantity over quality

abilities.name: Eyes on the Prize
abilities.description: A rust monster suffers no :setback: for targeting specific items with its Antenna Strike

abilities.name: Rust Metal
abilities.description: Any ferrous metal item struck by a rust monster's Antenna Strike is immediately damage by one step. The rust monster can spend :advantage: to damage it an additional step. It can do this as many times as it has Advantage to do so, until the item is destroyed

name: Scarab Swarm
description: Frequently found in ancient tombs, these brightly coloured beetles can quickly and easily reduce a party of unwary adventurers to gleaming bones.

name: Scorpion, Giant
description: Nearsighted, methodical hunters, giant scorpions can be very dangerous to the unwary.

abilities.name: Death Sting
abilities.description: When incapacitated, a giant scorpion makes one out-of-turn Brawl attack with its stinger against an engaged opponent. This check gains :boost:, and +2 damage

name: Spider, Giant
description: Giant spiders are found in nearly every adventuring environment. These arachnid predators are patient stalkers, waiting for prey to enter their webs, or walk within reach of their deadly fangs. Some are ambush predators, while others are swift hunters that aggressively pursue prey. This latter variety usually does not use webbing, but their bite attacks are more deadly.

name: Spider Broodling, Giant
description: Even newly-hatched giant spiders can be a dangerous threat to adventurers. These creatures are voracious from the moment they emerge from their eggs, and eagerly swarm any available prey. They lack the ability to spit venom, but their bite is just as deadly as an adult's, and their webbing just as strong.

name: Spider Matriarch, Giant
description: Giant spider matriarchs are huge creatures that possess much greater Intellect than most of their kind. Despite their size, they are quite stealthy.

abilities.name: Hatch Broodlings
abilities.description: A giant spider matriarch may spend a maneuver to hatch a clutch of its eggs, adding a spider broodling minion group to the encounter. The broodlings may act immediately

abilities.name: Paralytic Venom
abilities.description: A target wounded by a giant spider matriarch's fangs must make a :hard: Resilience check or be staggered until the end of its next turn. The giant spider matriarch may expend :threat::threat: or :despair: to extend the duration of the paralysis by one round

name: Stirge
description: Stirges are small flying monsters that feed on the blood of living creatures. They are fearless and persistent until they are satiated. While individually weak, they are dangerous in large numbers.

abilities.name: Attach
abilities.description: After a successful attack, a flock of stirges may spend :advantage::advantage: to attach to their target. On subsequent turns, a target with stirges attached suffers 3 wounds at the start of their turn. As an action, the target or an ally may make an :average: Athletics check to remove the attached stirges

weapons.name: Proboscis
weapons.notes: May spend :advantage::advantage: to inflict 2 additional wounds.

name: Stirge Swarm
description: A colony of hungry stirges can be a deadly threat to an adventuring party.

weapons.name: Proboscis
weapons.notes: May spend :advantage::advantage: to inflict 2 additional wounds.

name: Troll, Cave
description: Slow and stupid, but immensely strong and resilient, cave trolls are sometimes used as living war machines by cruel humanoids. They are frequently as dangerous to their allies as to their enemies.

abilities.name: Sweep Attack
abilities.description: (on a successful Brawl check, a cave troll can spend :advantage::advantage: per target to hit additional targets engaged with the first target

abilities.name: Regeneration
abilities.description: At the start of its turn, a cave troll automatically heals 3 Wounds, unless the damage was dealt by fire or acid

abilities.name: Chow Down
abilities.description: A cave troll that has Ensnared a target with its claws may spend :advantage::advantage: or :triumph: to make a Crushing Bite attack against that target

name: Troll, Swamp
description: Cruel, cunning, and eternally hungry, swamp trolls are a constant threat to river traffic and freshwater port communities.

abilities.name: Regeneration
abilities.description: At the start of its turn, a swamp troll automatically heals 2 Wounds, unless the damage was dealt by fire or acid

name: Tunnel Hulk
description: These murderous, insectoid abominations tunnel through the underworld, endlessly searching for prey. Their powerful claws can bore through solid rock, and their mind-scrambling gaze makes escape impossible for their victims.

abilities.name: Confusing Gaze
abilities.description: As a maneuver, a tunnel hulk can force a target within Short range to meet its potent gaze. If the target has not yet acted during the encounter, it cannot avoid the tunnel hulk's gaze. The target must make a :hard: Discipline check. If it succeeds, the target is disoriented until the end of its next turn. If it fails, the target is staggered until the end of its next turn. A tunnel hulk may use :threat::threat: generated by the target to cause the target to see the closest ally as an enemy, whom it must attack when it can next act. A creature may avoid the tunnel hulk's gaze by tightly closing its eyes or averting its gaze. In either case, while avoiding the tunnel hulk's gaze, the creature is treated as if it is suffering the Blinded Critical Injury

name: Winged Ape
description: These beasts resemble gorillas with red eyes and huge, batlike wings. They often serve evil sorcerers as sentries and guardians. They take sadistic glee in picking up victims and dropping them from high in the air.

abilities.name: Carry Off
abilities.description: If a winged ape hits a Silhouette 1 or smaller target with its Claws, it may force the target to make an opposed Athletics check. If the target fails, it is carried aloft by the winged ape, and is treated as Short range from the ground. The target can make another opposed Athletics check on its turn to break free, but will then fall if it has no means of flight. The winged ape can drop a carried target as an incidental on its next turn

name: Winter Wolf
description: These creatures look like white wolves, but they are actually cunning magical beasts. Winter wolves are frequently tamed by frost giants to serve as hunting hounds and guardians.

name: Yeti
description: This profile can be used for many large, savage, humanoid types. Just change their abilities to suit the terrain.

abilities.name: Camouflage
abilities.description: In snowy or mountainous environments, add 2 Boost to Stealth checks

abilities.name: Cold Adapted
abilities.description: Yeti are immune to the effects of cold or freezing environments

name: Bugbear Chief
description: Bugbears rule by strength, cunning, and fighting prowess. The scars on their chiefs serve as badges of honour, and as a warning.

abilities.name: Brutal Opportunist
abilities.description: A bugbear chief gains 1 Boost on its attack roll and +1 damage when it attacks a target that has not yet acted in the turn

abilities.name: Strength of Will
abilities.description: As an out-of-turn incidental, a bugbear chief may use its own Willpower for any Discipline check required of an allied bugbear within Short range

name: Boglok
description: Gloks dwell in swamps, tropical jungles, and other damp places. They are not evil, but they are highly territorial. They use their own secretions to poison their weapons.

abilities.name: Amphibious
abilities.description: A Boglok may hold its breath underwater for an hour, and never suffers movement penalties for moving through water

abilities.name: Poisoned Weapons
abilities.description: If a boglok wounds a target, the target must immediately make a :hard: Resilence check. Failure means the target is immobilized for one round, plus one round per :threat: generated. :despair: on a successful or failed check means the target is staggered for one round

name: Boglok Boss
description: Boglok hunting parties are led by bosses. While not the most formidable opponents, a boss can keep his hunters focused on bringing down a tough opponent.

abilities.name: Amphibious
abilities.description: A Boglok boss may hold its breath underwater for an hour, and never suffers movement penalties for moving through water

abilities.name: Poisoned Weapons
abilities.description: If a boglok boss wounds a target, the target must immediately make a :hard: Resilence check. Failure means the target is immobilized for one round, plus one round per :threat: generated. :despair: on a successful or failed check means the target is staggered for one round

name: Gnoll
description: Cruel, savage marauders, gnolls are hated and feared by all. Much like the hyaenas they resemble, gnoll packs are dominated by females rather than males.

name: Gnoll Pack Lord
description: A gnoll pack lord is the fiercest of her kind in a given pack. She can inspire her cackling followers to new heights of mayhem and savagery.

abilities.name: Incite Rampage
abilities.description: Once per turn, as a maneuver, a gnoll pack lord can compel an allied gnoll within Short range to make a melee attack against an engaged opponent

name: Goblin (Creature Catalogue)
description: Weak but cunning, goblins value strength in numbers above all else (except living to fight another day).

abilities.name: Discretion
abilities.description: A goblin may disengage as an incidental rather than a maneuver

name: Goblin Boss
description: Goblin bosses are crafty survivors who know when to run off and leave their comrades to die valiantly.

abilities.name: Discretion
abilities.description: A goblin boss may disengage as an incidental rather than a maneuver

abilities.name: Die For Me!
abilities.description: If struck by an attack, a goblin boss may spend :threat::threat: to cause an unengaged goblin within Short range to be hit by the attack instead

name: Kobold Warrior
description: These humanoid canines love gems and precious metals, and are frequently found in abandoned mines, though a tribe will occasionally assault and occupy a working mine. They are especially hated by dwarves.

name: Kobold Spearman
description: Kobolds dislike complex weapons, and avoid bows and crossbows. Spearmen are capable of hurling javelins with great accuracy. They usually carry enough light spears or javelins to last an entire encounter.

name: Kobold Shaman
description: These kobolds have learned the rudiments of Divine magic, and use their powers to protect, heal, and strengthen their tribe. Kobolds usually worship Hurnos, but some more savage tribes may serve Nerukk.

abilities.name: Strength of the Pack
abilities.description: A kobold shaman is immune to fear or Coercion while any allied kobolds are in line of sight

abilities.name: Spiteful Curse
abilities.description: Add :boost::boost: to magic actions that target a character who has previously inflicted wounds on the kobold shaman during this encounter

abilities.name: Spells: Agonizing Hex
abilities.description: Choose a target at short or medium range for this attack and make an :average: Divine check. If successful, this magic attack inflicts 6 damage +1 damage per :success:, with the Disorient 2 and Knockdown qualities.

abilities.name: Spells: Bad Luck
abilities.description: Choose a target at short or medium range and make a :hard: Divine check. If successful, the target decreases the ability of any skill checks they make by 1 until the end of the kobold shamans’s next turn, and when the target makes a check, may change one :setback: die to a face displaying Failure. The kobold shaman may maintain these effects by performing the concentrate maneuver.

abilities.name: Spells: Restore the Pack
abilities.description: Choose an allied target at short or medium range and make an :average: Divine check. The target and one other allied target within range are healed for one wound per :success:, and remove a status effect from which they are suffering. Advantage can be also be spent to affect additional targets, one target per Advantage.

gear: Kobold fetish (Implement; the kobold shaman may add the Additional Target quality and the first Range effect to an attack spell without increasing the difficulty)

name: Kobold Alpha
description: These burly kobolds dominate their packs through strength and ferocity. They will never back down from a fight if any packmates are still fighting.

abilities.name: Strength of the Pack
abilities.description: A kobold alpha is immune to fear or Coercion while any allied kobolds are in line of sight

name: Greater Kobold
description: Greater kobolds tower over their kin, and dominate the tribes in which they dwell. Most tribes rarely have more than two or three greater kobolds, as these powerful creatures chafe at any perceived threat to their supremacy.

abilities.name: Leader of the Pack
abilities.description: A greater kobold is immune to fear or Coercion

name: Tae Ew Sauran
description: Bloodthirsty and violent, Tae Ew Sauran will aggressively defend their territory from intruders, and will hunt human prey as readily as animal.

abilities.name: Amphibious
abilities.description: A Tae Ew Sauran may hold its breath underwater for an hour, and never suffers movement penalties for moving through water

name: Tae Ew Sauran Shaman
description: A Tae Ew Sauran shaman guides its tribe to new hunting grounds, and grants them strength in battle. They are formidable opponents.

abilities.name: Amphibious
abilities.description: A Tae Ew Sauran shaman may hold its breath underwater for an hour, and never suffers movement penalties for moving through water

abilities.name: Battle Strength
abilities.description: As a maneuver, a Tae Ew Sauran shaman may spend a Story Point to grant itself or an allied Tae Ew Sauran within Short range +3 damage on its next attack

name: Ratten
description: Cunning and furtive, Ratten frequently dwell in the shadows and sewers of greater civilizations, plotting murder and domination.

abilities.name: Rat Fever
abilities.description: A target wounded by a Ratten's bite must make a :hard: Resilence check. On a failure, their Brawn characteristic is reduced by one, and they are disoriented. This effect lasts until they receive treatment, either an :average: Medicine check, or magical Restoration

name: Ratten Shadeblade
description: While not exactly leaders, shadeblades are valued, and feared, members of Ratten warpacks. Their scythe-like blades have brought down many unwary foes.

abilities.name: Backstabber
abilities.description: On a successful melee attack, a Ratten shadeblade may spend a Story Point to add +3 damage to one hit

abilities.name: Dual Wielder
abilities.description: A Ratten shadeblade decreases the difficulty of the next combined combat check it makes during the same turn by one

abilities.name: Rat Fever
abilities.description: A target wounded by a Ratten shadeblade's bite must make a :hard: Resilence check. On a failure, their Brawn characteristic is reduced by one, and they are disoriented. This effect lasts until they receive treatment, either an :average: Medicine check, or magical Restoration

name: Sea Devil
description: These monstrous marine marauders are greatly feared by sailors and coastal communities. They dislike bright light, and prefer to attack their surface targets during the dark of the new moon.

name: Sea Devil Myrmidon
description: Most who see a sea devil myrmidon flee at once. Their hulking, four-armed, hammerheaded forms mean death has arrived.

abilities.name: Blood in the Water
abilities.description: A sea devil myrmidon gains +2 damage against any target that has suffered one or more Wounds

abilities.name: Multiattack
abilities.description: A sea devil myrmidon does not increase the difficulty of combined checks to attack with all of its weapons, and may spend :advantage::advantage: or :triumph: to hit with each additional weapon

name: Troglodyte
description: These sly, degenerate subterranean reptilians are hated for their sadistic ways and their unbearable stench.

abilities.name: Nauseating Stench
abilities.description: Any character that begins their turn engaged with a troglodyte must make a :hard: Resilence check. On a success, they are disoriented for one round. On a failure, they are staggered for one round. A :triumph: on this check means they do not have to make the check again during this encounter

name: Troglodyte Berserker
description: Slow-witted but incredibly savage, troglodyte berserkers are kept pacified with strange mushrooms and cave moulds until they are needed for battle.

abilities.name: Nauseating Stench
abilities.description: Any character that begins their turn engaged with a troglodyte berserker must make a :hard: Resilence check. On a success, they are disoriented for one round. On a failure, they are staggered for one round. A :triumph: on this check means they do not have to make the check again during this encounter

abilities.name: Furious
abilities.description: A troglodye berserker is immune to fear or Coercion

abilities.name: Berserker
abilities.description: When a troglodyte berserker suffers one or more wounds, it deals +1 damage with all attacks. If it suffers a Critically Injury, it deals +2 damage with all attacks

name: Ghast
description: These wicked undead are often found leading packs of ghouls, turning a band of savages into a fearsome threat.

abilities.name: Stench
abilities.description: Any character that begins their turn engaged with a ghast must make an :average: Resilience check. On a success, they are disoriented for one round. On a failure, they are staggered for one round. A :triumph: on this check means they do not have to make the check again during this encounter

abilities.name: Defiant Undead
abilities.description: Increase the difficulty of any Divine check made against a ghast by one

name: Ghoul
description: Ferocious and nearly mindless, ghouls hunger for the flesh of the dead. When they can't find dead flesh to devour, they find living flesh and make it dead as quickly as possible.

name: Hullathoin
description: A hullathoin is among the most powerful and destructive of all undead. It resembles a gargantuan quadrupedal reptile with a vaguely crocodilian head. It has a mottled, rotting grey and black hide, and is covered in leaking, pustulent sores. Two long, barbed tentacles extend from its shoulders. A hullathoin is usually surrounded by a cloud of bloodfiend stirges, and accompanied by packs of vampire spawn, zombies, ghouls, and other undead. Despite its bestial appearance, a hullathoin is highly Intellect, and will coordinate the attacks of its minions to its greatest advantage.

abilities.name: Colossal
abilities.description: If a hullathoin suffers a Critical Injury, subtract -30 from the Critical Injury result

abilities.name: Command Undead
abilities.description: A hullathoin can direct the actions of any undead with a Willpower lower than 3 within Long range as an out-of-turn incidental

abilities.name: Expel Stirges
abilities.description: As a maneuver, a hullathoin may spend a Story Point to expel a stirge swarm from its body. The swarm appears at engaged range of the hullathoin, and can act immediately. The stirges will attack any living targets engaged with the hullathoin, or move to the nearest living targets

abilities.name: Pus Explosion
abilities.description: Once per encounter as an action, a hullathoin may convulse its body, spewing its toxic pus in all directions. This affects all living targets within Short range. Affected targets must make a :daunting: Resilience check or suffer four wounds and be staggered until the end of their next turn. Targets who succeed at their check suffer two wounds and are disoriented until the end of their next turn. A :despair: result means the target takes damage again on their next turn, and the effects are extended by one turn

abilities.name: Toxic Tentacles
abilities.description: Targets wounded by a hullathoin's tentacles must make a :hard: Resilience check as an out-of-turn incidental or suffer four additional wounds from its venom. If the check generates :despair:, they must check again on their next turn. If a hullathoin Ensnares a target with its tentacle attack, it can drag the target one range band closer to it [to a minimum range of engaged] as an incidental

name: Mummified Jackal
description: These creatures are often found guarding tombs and sacred sites, as vigilant and relentless in death as they were in life.

abilities.name: Pack Tactics
abilities.description: When using the assist maneuver, wolves add 2 Boost instead of 1

name: Mummy
description: Mummies are preserved corpses reanimated to serve as guardians. While slow moving, they are immensely tough and strong. They are especially feared for the terrible wasting curse they can inflict on defilers of their tombs.

abilities.name: Slow Moving
abilities.description: A mummy can spend no more than one maneuver per turn to move

abilities.name: Mummy’s Curse
abilities.description: A living creature struck by a mummy’s fist attack must make a :hard: Resilience check. If they fail, they are afflicted with the mummy’s curse: reduce their wound and strain thresholds by 4, and subtract one from all ability checks. They must repeat this check each day [with the same result for failure] until they succeed, or are Incapacitated (at which point they die and turn to dust

name: Necromantic Swarm
description: A necromantic swarm consists of innumerable dismembered body parts, including hands, feet, arms, legs, and heads. Necromancers with particularly horrid senses of humour occasionally animate necromantic swarms to protect their lairs (or simply out of boredom and a surplus of spare parts).

abilities.name: Teeming Threat
abilities.description: As a maneuver, a swarm may engage all living targets within Short range, and take an attack action against each target

abilities.name: Swarm
abilities.description: Halve the damage dealt to the swarm before applying soak, unless the weapon has the Blast or Burn quality [regardless of whether the quality is activated]

abilities.name: Show of Hands
abilities.description: Enemies who are Engaged with a necromantic swarm at the start of their turn must make a :hard: Resilience check as an incidental or suffer 4 wounds

name: Reanimated Hand
description: A reanimated hand is a combination of alchemy and necromancy. The creature appears as a severed hand, but monstrously huge, with a toothy maw in its palm. It moves about by walking on its fingers, and pounces upon victims to crush them in its grip while savaging them with its bite. They are often found in the lairs of evil wizards or powerful undead.

abilities.name: Magic Resistance
abilities.description: A reanimated hand upgrades the difficulty of any magic skill check targeting it by one

abilities.name: Flying Punch
abilities.description: A reanimated hand may ball into a fist and launch itself at an enemy. If it hits, it becomes Engaged with that enemy as an incidental

abilities.name: Death Grip
abilities.description: If a reanimated hand Ensnares a target with its Smack attack, it grips the target tightly and begins to squeeze, while ferociously biting at the same time. The target suffers 4 additional wounds, and is immobilized. The target suffers another 4 wounds each turn that the hand continues its Death Grip. Either the target (or an ally) must succeed at an opposed Athletics check as an action on their turn to free the target from the hand. A reanimated hand cannot attack other targets while using its Death Grip, but may release its target as an incidental.

name: Skeleton (Creature Catalogue)
description: The most common form of undead, animated skeletons are found in crypts, tombs, dungeons, and anywhere that necromancers are active. They are silent, tenacious, and dangerous in large numbers.

abilities.name: Undying
abilities.description: May spend :threat::threat::threat: from any check made by a PC to return one previously defeated skeleton to an existing minion group, removing damage from the group accordingly. Spend :despair: to return two skeletons to a minion group

name: Skeleton Mage
description: Skeleton mages are undead created from fallen spellcasters. They still retain much of their former magical power, and are clever, deadly foes.

abilities.name: Spells: Enervating Curse
abilities.description: A skeleton mage may make a :hard: Arcana check against a target, if successful, the target reduces its Ability for all checks by one until the end of its next turn. In addition, if the target suffers strain for any reason, they suffer 1 additional strain

abilities.name: Spells: Ghostly Barrier
abilities.description: A skeleton mage is surrounded by a misty barrier that increases Defense by one and adds +1 Soak

name: Skeleton Warrior
description: Some skeletons are imbued with greater necromantic power, or contain some vestige of the warrior from whom they were created. These skeleton warriors are often found leading other skeletons, and are formidable opponents.

abilities.name: Skeleton Commander
abilities.description: Any skeleton minion groups within Medium range of a skeleton warrior gain +2 damage.

name: Viscid Cube
description: Viscid cubes slide through dungeon halls, devouring all organic matter they encounter. Many times adventurers do not notice the cube until it is too late.

abilities.name: Transparent
abilities.description: Even when the cube is in plain sight, it takes a :hard: Vigilance check to spot a cube that has neither moved nor attacked. A creature that tries to enter the cube's space while unaware of the cube is automatically engulfed.

abilities.name: Engulf
abilities.description: A viscid cube's primary method of attack is brutally simple: it engulfs and dissolves its victims. A cube may use its action to attempt to engulf a target it is Engaged with. The target must make a :hard: Coordination check to avoid being engulfed. If the target succeeds, they remain at Engaged range of the cube. If the target is engulfed, it is pulled into the cube, where it is immobilized and begins to suffocate. At the beginning of its turn, the target suffers 3 wounds from the cube's acidic interior and 3 strain each round until it is freed, escapes, or is incapacitated. When the cube moves, the engulfed target moves with it. An engulfed creature can try to escape by taking an action to make a :hard: Athletics check. On a success, the creature escapes to Engaged range of the cube. A creature Engaged with the cube may attempt to pull an object or creature from within the cube. This is an opposed Athletics check against the cube. If successful, the selected object or creature is drawn out of the cube. Whether successful or not, the creature attempting the action suffers 3 wounds. A viscid cube can engulf up to 10 Silhouette 0 creatures, 4 Silhouette 1 creatures, or 1 Silhouette 2 creature.

name: Dreadgazer
description: A dreadgazer is a malevolent spherical being 10' in diameter, armour plated, with a huge central eye over a drooling maw of sharp teeth. Ten smaller eyestalks emerge from its surface, peering angrily about in all directions. It moves by hovering silently through the air. Cruel, paranoid, and highly Intellect, the dreadgazer is one of the most terrifying enemies adventurers can face.

abilities.name: Anti-Magic Field
abilities.description: As an incidental, the dreadgazer may aim its central eye at a target within Long range. That target, and anyone within Short range of that target, is unable to use magic skills, and magical properties of items become non-functional. The dreadgazer may not target foes affected by Anti-Magic Field with Eye Blast that turn

abilities.name: Eye Blast
abilities.description: As an action, the dreadgazer may attack with three of its eyestalks, selected at random from the abilities below [reroll any duplicates], against one to three targets within Long range. The dreadgazer suffers no penalty for targeting  creatures at Engaged range. Each attack is an :average: Arcana check.

abilities.name: Eye Blast 01: Charm Ray
abilities.description: The target takes no damage, but must make a :daunting: Discipline check as an out-of-turn incidental. If it fails, it is controlled by the dreadgazer until the end of its next turn. The dreadgazer may choose the target's maneuvers and actions, but while affected, the target is disoriented.

abilities.name: Eye Blast 02: Paralyzing Ray
abilities.description: The target takes no damage, but must make a :daunting: Resilence check as an out-of-turn incidental. If it fails, it is immobilized and staggered until the end of its next turn.

abilities.name: Eye Blast 03: Fear Ray
abilities.description: The target takes no damage, but must make a :daunting: Discipline check as an out-of-turn incidental. If it fails, it must spend its next turn using all maneuvers and actions to flee away from the dreadgazer.

abilities.name: Eye Blast 04: Slowing Ray
abilities.description: The target takes no damage, but must make a :daunting: Resilence check as an out-of-turn incidental. If it fails, on its next turn the target may only use one maneuver, cannot downgrade its action to a maneuver, and cannot change range bands. The target also suffers :setback::setback::setback: on any actions it takes.

abilities.name: Eye Blast 05: Enervation Ray
abilities.description: This attack deals 8 damage, with a Critical Rating of 4. The target must make a :daunting: Resilence check as an out-of-turn incidental. If it fails, it suffers additional damage equal to half of its remaining Wounds, and suffers an equal amount of Strain.

abilities.name: Eye Blast 06: Telekinetic Ray
abilities.description: The target takes no damage, but is immobilized until the end of its next turn, and must make a :daunting: Resilence check as an out-of-turn incidental. If it fails, it is moved one range band in a direction of the dreadgazer's choice. The dreadgazer may spend :advantage::advantage::advantage: or :triumph: on the check to move the target an additional range band. It may do this more than once.

abilities.name: Eye Blast 07: Sleep Ray
abilities.description: The target takes no damage, but must make a :daunting: Discipline check as an out-of-turn incidental. If it fails, it falls asleep for four rounds. The target is awakened early if it takes damage, or if another character engages it and takes an action to wake it.

abilities.name: Eye Blast 08: Petrification Ray
abilities.description: The target must make a :daunting: Resilience check as an out-of-turn incidental. If it fails, it is immobilized and disoriented until the end of its next turn, when it may make another :daunting: Resilience check as an out-of-turn incidental. If it succeeds, the effect ends. If the second check fails, the target is turned to stone and indefinitely Incapacitated. This may be dispelled by a successful :daunting: Arcana check, or the character may be restored by a successful :daunting: Heal check (using Divine or Primal).

abilities.name: Eye Blast 09: Disintegration Ray
abilities.description: The target must make a :daunting: Coordination check as an out-of-turn incidental. If it fails, the attack deals 16 damage with the Pierce 5 and Vicious 5 qualities, and a Critical Rating of 2. If this attack incapacitates the target, it is considered disintegrated into dust; no resurrection is possible. If the target is a Silhouette 2 or smaller non-magical object or creation of magical force, it is disintegrated. If the target is a Silhouette 3 or larger object or creation of magical force, this ray disintegrates a l0-foot sphere of it.

abilities.name: Eye Blast 10: Death Ray
abilities.description: The target must make a :daunting: Coordination check as an out-of-turn incidental. If it fails, the attack deals 16 damage with the Breach 1 and Vicious 5 qualities, and a Critical Rating of 2. A living target that is Incapacitated by this attack dies immediately.

name: Lich
notes: A lich’s soul is tied to a special item called a phylactery. This item is always carefully hidden. If a lich is destroyed, it gains a new body in seven days, appearing within 5 feet of the phylactery. If its phylactery is destroyed, a lich cannot reform, and is permanently destroyed.
description: Liches are powerful, evil spellcasters who have conquered death. They typically appear as desiccated or skeletonized humans in ancient robes, bearing artifacts of great power, with coldly glowing eyes. These beings are extraordinarily Intellect, foresighted, and cruel: it is very hard to take a lich by surprise, and even harder to permanently destroy one.

abilities.name: Spell Turning
abilities.description: When targeted by a magic skill check, a lich may spend a Story Point and suffer 4 strain as an out-of-turn incidental to cause the spell to target another character instead

abilities.name: Spells: Disintegrate
abilities.description: Choose a target at short or medium range for this attack and make a :hard: Arcana check. If successful, this magic attack inflicts 10 damage +1 damage per :success:, with the Pierce 5, Vicious 5 and Sunder qualities, and a Critical Rating of 2.

abilities.name: Spells: Ice Storm (Signature Spell)
abilities.description: Choose a target at short or medium range for this attack and make a :hard: Arcana check. If successful, this magic attack inflicts 10 damage +1 damage per :success:, with the Blast 5, Ensnare 5, and Vicious 5 qualities, and a Critical Rating of 2. If the Blast quality is triggered, it affects all targets within short range of the target rather than engaged.

abilities.name: Spells: Arcane Barrier
abilities.description: Make a :hard: Arcana check; if successful, until the end of the lich’s next turn, reduce the damage of all hits against them by one, plus one for every Success, and the lich gains +5 defense (to a maximum of 4). The lich can maintain these effects with the concentrate maneuver.

gear: Diadem of Power (Implement; the lich may add the Deadly and Empowered qualities to an attack spell without increasing the difficulty. Add :advantage: to the result of any successful spell check)

name: Beetle, Giant Bombardier
description: Giant beetles are a common threat found in nearly every non-arctic environment. Some, like fire beetles, are a valuable resource to fledgling adventurers. While most are similar in nature, these giant beetles are aggressive hunters, and are feared for their ability to spray a blast of super-heated caustic fluid when attacked.

name: Beetle, Giant Death
description: Giant beetles are a common threat found in nearly every non-arctic environment. Some, like fire beetles, are a valuable resource to fledgling adventurers. While most are similar in nature, these giant beetles are easily recognized by the “death's head” markings on their carapace, and are scavengers and carrion eaters, but will aggressively attack anything they consider a threat. Their huge mandibles are deadly.

name: Beetle, Giant Fire
description: Giant beetles are a common threat found in nearly every non-arctic environment. Some, like fire beetles, are a valuable resource to fledgling adventurers. The luminous eyes of fire beetles continue to provide smokeless illumination for days after the beetle's demise. Hunting fire beetles is often a rite of passage for new delvers.
